# meraki_networks_group_policy (Resource)





<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String) The name of the group policy.
- `network_id` (String) The network Id where the group policy is applied.

### Optional

- `bandwidth` (Attributes) The bandwidth settings of the group policy. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--bandwidth))
- `bonjour_forwarding` (Attributes) The bonjour forwarding settings of the group policy. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--bonjour_forwarding))
- `content_filtering` (Attributes) The content filtering settings of the group policy. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--content_filtering))
- `firewall_and_traffic_shaping` (Attributes) The firewall and traffic shaping settings of the group policy. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--firewall_and_traffic_shaping))
- `scheduling` (Attributes) The scheduling settings of the group policy. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--scheduling))
- `splash_auth_settings` (String) The splash authentication settings of the group policy.
- `vlan_tagging` (Attributes) The VLAN tagging settings of the group policy. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--vlan_tagging))

### Read-Only

- `group_policy_id` (String) The unique identifier for the group policy.
- `id` (String) The unique identifier for the resource, generated by the Meraki API.

<a id="nestedatt--bandwidth"></a>
### Nested Schema for `bandwidth`

Required:

- `settings` (String)

Optional:

- `bandwidth_limits` (Attributes) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--bandwidth--bandwidth_limits))

<a id="nestedatt--bandwidth--bandwidth_limits"></a>
### Nested Schema for `bandwidth.bandwidth_limits`

Optional:

- `limit_down` (Number) The download bandwidth limit. Can be null.
- `limit_up` (Number) The upload bandwidth limit. Can be null.

Optional:
